page.title: 10Witchampton Church
page.content: The church is under the patronge of the Hon.Mrs Marten and is dedicated to St Cuthberga, St Mary and All Saints. None of the old church is left except for the 15th century tower. It has been said that the tower possibly dates back to the 12th century. The tower clock dates from the early 18th century. Inside the church all that remains of the old building is the bowl of the font - this was found in a field being used as a cattle trough! The pulpit is circa 1750 and there is a fine East window by Sir Ninian Comper. The main church was rebuilt after a fire and the South Transept bears the date 1832. The Chancel, Nave and North Transept were rebuilt in 1844 and the organ chamber and vestry were added in 1898, the builder being H Story. The church and the chapel are still part of village life.
